title: Past, Present, and Future

vocab.definition: Something that already happened before now

teachingNotes: Use timeline of student's day. Show pictures of how things looked long ago vs. now. Discuss personal growth and changes.

sample.question: When you were a baby, were you bigger or smaller than you are now?
What are you doing right now?
How were toys different in the past?

truefalse.question: The past is the same as the future.
expectedAny: past and future are different times

truefalse.question: You are bigger now than when you were a baby.
The present is happening right now.

multiplechoice.question: Which word describes what you are doing right now?
How did people travel long ago before cars?
expectedAny: horses were used for travel in the past

multiplechoice.question: What describes something that already happened?
What might happen in the future?

fillintheblank.question: Something that already happened is in the _____.
What is happening right now is the _____.
When you were little, that was in the _____.
Next week will happen in the _____.
Long ago, people lived in the _____.

shortanswer.question: How have you changed since you were a baby?
What is something your grandparents did that is different from what you do?
What do you want to do when you grow up?
How are schools different now than in the past?
What do you think houses will look like in the future?
How do we learn about the past?
What changes do you see from morning to night?

wordProblems.question: Grandma was born 60 years ago. Mom was born 30 years ago. How many years older is Grandma than Mom?
This week, Emma read 4 books about the past and 3 books about the future. How many books did she read total?
In the past, there were 2 horses for travel. Now there are 8 cars on the street. How many more vehicles are there now?
Yesterday, Tom collected 5 old coins. Today he collected 3 more old coins. How many old coins does he have total?
In the future, Sarah wants to visit 10 places. She has already visited 4 places in the past. How many more places does she want to visit?
The museum has 12 pictures of the past and 7 pictures of the present. How many pictures do they have altogether?
Long ago, there were 15 trees in the park. Now there are only 9 trees. How many trees are gone?
